item.title: Is a secure AI assistant possible?
item.description: AI agents are a risky business. Even when stuck inside the chatbox window, LLMs will make mistakes and behave badly. Once they have tools that they can use to interact with the outside world, such as web browsers and email addresses, the consequences of those mistakes become far more serious. That...

item.title: Nevada Unveils New Statewide Data Classification Policy Months After Cyberattack
item.description: Officials said data will now be classified as one of four categories: ‚Äúpublic,‚Äù ‚Äúsensitive,‚Äù ‚Äúconfidential‚Äù or ‚Äúrestricted.‚Äù The post Nevada Unveils New Statewide Data Classification Policy Months After Cyberattack appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: First Malicious Outlook Add-In Found Stealing 4,000+ Microsoft Credentials
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have discovered what they said is the first known malicious Microsoft Outlook add-in detected in the wild. item.title: Kimwolf Botnet Swamps Anonymity Network I2P
item.description: For the past week, the massive "Internet of Things" (IoT) botnet known as Kimwolf has been disrupting the The Invisible Internet Project (I2P), a decentralized, encrypted communications network designed to anonymize and secure online communications. I2P users started reporting disruptions in the...

item.title: APT36 and SideCopy Launch Cross-Platform RAT Campaigns Against Indian Entities
item.description: Indian defense sector and government-aligned organizations have been targeted by multiple campaigns that are designed to compromise Windows and Linux environments with remote access trojans capable of stealing sensitive data and ensuring continued access to infected machines. The campaigns are...

item.title: GitGuardian Raises $50 Million for Secrets and Non-Human Identity Security
item.description: The secrets security company has raised more than $100 million since its creation in 2017. The post GitGuardian Raises $50 Million for Secrets and Non-Human Identity Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Conduent Breach Hits Volvo Group: Nearly 17,000 Employees‚Äô Data Exposed
item.description: The Conduent data breach affects at least 25 million individuals, up from 10 million estimated a few months ago. The post Conduent Breach Hits Volvo Group: Nearly 17,000 Employees’ Data Exposed appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Zast.AI Raises $6 Million for AI-Powered Code Security
item.description: The startup relies on AI agents to identify software vulnerabilities and validate them before reporting. The post Zast.AI Raises $6 Million for AI-Powered Code Security appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Over 60 Software Vendors Issue Security Fixes Across OS, Cloud, and Network Platforms
item.description: It's Patch Tuesday, which means a number of software vendors have released patches for various security vulnerabilities impacting their products and services. Microsoft issued fixes for 59 flaws, including six actively exploited zero-days in various Windows components that could be abused to bypass...

item.title: Exposed Training Open the Door for Crypto-Mining in Fortune 500 Cloud Environments
item.description: Intentionally vulnerable training applications are widely used for security education, internal testing, and product demonstrations. Tools such as OWASP Juice Shop, DVWA, Hackazon, and bWAPP are designed to be insecure by default, making them useful for learning how common attack techniques work in...

item.title: Microsoft Patches 59 Vulnerabilities Including Six Actively Exploited Zero-Days
item.description: Microsoft on Tuesday released security updates to address a set of 59 flaws across its software, including six vulnerabilities that it said have been exploited in the wild. Of the 59 flaws, five are rated Critical, 52 are rated Important, and two are rated Moderate in severity. Twenty-five of the...

item.title: EVs could be cheaper to own than gas cars in Africa by 2040
item.description: Electric vehicles could be economically competitive in Africa sooner than expected. Just 1% of new cars sold across the continent in 2025 were electric, but a new analysis finds that with solar off-grid charging, EVs could be cheaper to own than gas vehicles by 2040. There are major barriers to...

item.description: XPeng Aridge‚Äôs ‚ÄúLand Aircraft Carrier‚Äù flying car passed ‚Äì35¬∞C extreme cold tests with stable ground and flight performance ahead of its 2026 rollout.

item.title: Dexmal Unveils DM0, the World‚Äôs First Embodied-Native Foundation Model
item.description: Dexmal unveiled DM0, the world‚Äôs first embodied-native foundation model, whose 2.4B version tops RoboChallenge rankings and is now fully open-sourced.

item.title: Ant Group Open-Sources Full-Modality Model Ming-Flash-Omni 2.0
item.description: Ant Group has open-sourced Ming-Flash-Omni 2.0, a unified multimodal model capable of generating speech, music, and sound effects in a single track with fine-grained natural language control.

item.title: ENGINEAI Launches World‚Äôs First Commercial Humanoid Robot Fighting League
item.description: ENGINEAI has launched the world‚Äôs first commercial humanoid robot fighting league, offering up to USD 1.4 million in prizes to accelerate embodied AI development through real combat.

item.title: SenseTime-Backed ACE Robotics Raises Angel Round Led by Ant Group
item.description: SenseTime-backed ACE Robotics has raised an angel round led by Ant Group to scale its embodied AI ‚Äúsuper brain‚Äù and Kairos 3.0 world model for industrial deployment.

item.title: PABU: Progress-Aware Belief Update for Efficient LLM Agents
item.description: arXiv:2602.09138v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Model (LLM) agents commonly condition actions on full action-observation histories, which introduce task-irrelevant information that easily leads to redundant actions and higher inference cost. We propose Progress-Aware Belief Update...

item.description: arXiv:2602.09159v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent multi-agent frameworks have broadened the ability to tackle oncology decision support tasks that require reasoning over dynamic, heterogeneous patient data. item.title: Learning to Remember, Learn, and Forget in Attention-Based Models
item.description: arXiv:2602.09075v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In-Context Learning (ICL) in transformers acts as an online associative memory and is believed to underpin their high performance on complex sequence processing tasks. However, in gated linear attention models, this memory has a fixed capacity and is...

item.title: Patient foundation model for risk stratification in low-risk overweight patients
item.description: arXiv:2602.09079v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Accurate risk stratification in patients with overweight or obesity is critical for guiding preventive care and allocating high-cost therapies such as GLP-1 receptor agonists. item.title: Looping Back to Move Forward: Recursive Transformers for Efficient and Flexible Large Multimodal Models
item.description: arXiv:2602.09080v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Multimodal Models (LMMs) have achieved remarkable success in vision-language tasks, yet their vast parameter counts are often underutilized during both training and inference. In this work, we embrace the idea of looping back to move forward:...

item.description: arXiv:2602.09269v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Inclusion, equity, and access are widely valued in AI and education, yet are often assessed through coarse sample descriptors or post-hoc self-reports that miss how inclusion is shaped moment by moment in collaborative problem solving (CPS). In this...

item.title: Effective Reasoning Chains Reduce Intrinsic Dimensionality
item.description: arXiv:2602.09276v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning and its variants have substantially improved the performance of language models on complex reasoning tasks, yet the precise mechanisms by which different strategies facilitate generalization remain poorly understood....

item.description: arXiv:2602.09312v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Utilizing Large Language Models (LLM) as chatbots in diverse business scenarios often presents the challenge of maintaining topic continuity. Abrupt shifts in topics can lead to poor user experiences and inefficient utilization of computational...

item.title: Beyond Uniform Credit: Causal Credit Assignment for Policy Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2602.09331v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Policy gradient methods for language model reasoning, such as GRPO and DAPO, assign uniform credit to all generated tokens - the filler phrase "Let me think" receives the same gradient update as the critical calculation "23 + 45 = 68." We propose...

item.title: Step-resolved data attribution for looped transformers

Existing training-data influence estimators such as TracIn yield a single scalar score that aggregates over all...

item.title: Causality in Video Diffusers is Separable from Denoising
item.description: Causality -- referring to temporal, uni-directional cause-effect relationships between components -- underlies many complex generative processes, including videos, language, and robot trajectories. Current causal diffusion models entangle temporal reasoning with iterative denoising, applying causal...

item.title: Quantum-Audit: Evaluating the Reasoning Limits of LLMs on Quantum Computing
item.description: Language models have become practical tools for quantum computing education and research, from summarizing technical papers to explaining theoretical concepts and answering questions about recent developments in the field. While existing benchmarks evaluate quantum code generation and circuit...
